The Delhi High Court on Wednesday issued notice on a bail plea by former JNU student-activist Sharjeel Imam challenging an earlier court order which had…

Delhi HC Issues Notice on Bail Plea by Sharjeel Imam in Hate Speech Case

< div> India oi- Rahul Kumar Updated: Friday, March 11, 2022, 19:36 [IST]

New Delhi, March 11: Pakistan on Thursday accused India of firing “supersonic projectiles” from India on March 9. Pakistan feared it was a supersonic missile fired from Sirsa in Haryana. Taking Pakistan’s allegations seriously, the Defense Ministry has ordered a high-level inquiry. At the same time, India has expressed regret over the incident. The Defense Ministry, in its official response to the missile strike in Pakistan, said, “The accident was due to a technical glitch and we are deeply saddened by the incident.” Pakistan has summoned the Indian embassy in-charge. Did And the ‘Flying Indian Supersonic Object’ has been strongly protested for violating the airspace without provocation. The Defense Ministry said on Friday that it had received information that the missile had landed in an area of ​​Pakistan. This incident is very sad. It is also a matter of relief that no casualties were reported in the accident. On 9 March 2022, a missile fire broke out due to a technical glitch during routine maintenance. The Indian government has ordered a high-level court inquiry into the matter. Pakistan’s foreign office said the Indian diplomat had been informed of the alleged violation of airspace by a “flying Indian supersonic object”. Pakistan has said that an item coming from India at a speed of 124 kmph fell in Pakistan’s Khanewal district. The consignment entered Pakistan from Suratgarh, India on March 9 at 6.43 pm. The missile struck the ground in Mian Chunnu town in Pakistan’s Punjab province at 6.50 pm the same day, damaging civilian property. War between Russia and Ukraine could stop! Putin hinted at his statement The DG of ISPR, the media wing of the Pakistan Army, told a press conference that the missile was without a warhead (meaning it did not contain ammunition and had been fired for training) and was to fall into the Mahajan area. Firing range in Rajasthan but it fell in Mia Chunnu area of ​​Pakistan. Pakistan has claimed that it did not cause any casualties, but it was against international aviation security and could have caused a major accident.
